explains: v. 食言，违约；（桥牌、惠斯特等牌戏中）有牌不跟；<古>拒绝，放弃

sentences.en: It says firmly that the EU must not renege on its promise.
sentences.cn: 报告非常坚定地声称欧盟一定不会食言。

sentences.en: For one thing history tells us that the Republican Party would renege on its side of any deal as soon as it got the chance.
sentences.cn: 首先，历史告诉我们，共和党一有机会就会单方面背弃任何协定。

sentences.en: For one thing, history tells us that the Republican Party would renege on its side of any deal as soon as it got the chance.
sentences.cn: 首先，历史告诉我们，共和党一有机会就会单方面背弃任何协定。
